quest.name: The Necromancer
quest.info:
After completing your previous quest, you retire with your riches to take a much needed break. You can now afford luxuries that you never had before - a large house, exquisite foods, fine clothes. A year passes by peacefully.
You should have noticed the warning signs sooner, but they seemed isolated incidents at first. Late on one summer evening whilst walking along a country road, you saw what looked like a grinning skeleton behind some trees, but before you could investigate closer, whatever it was had vanished, and you passed it off as a trick of the light.
...
News has been received from other villages of a spreading evil across the land - the dead are rising from their graves, say the reports, and some villages have completely fallen under the control of undead legions.
Many suspect the work of a necromancer to be the cause, and there are rumours that that a great army of undead will soon sweep across the land.
You are eager to do what you can to help. You head east towards the village of Axbury. There you should seek out a person named Borin, who is known for being knowledgable in these matters.

start_bonus.armour: This plate armour is blessed with ancient Dwarven magic, offering greater protection, though it is just as heavy.

location.name: Axbury

scenery.name: Signpost
scenery.confirm_text: Do you wish to travel east to the town of Middleham?

location.scenery: This worn and battered old scarecrow watches over the fields. As you examine it, for a moment you are sure that there is some movement - a slight turn of the head, a movement of its makeshift eyes, and you have a feeling of being watched. It must be your eyes playing tricks on you.

npc.name: Peasant
npc.opening_initial: Hello - have you heard the news about the dead coming out of their graves?
npc.opening_later: Hello - have you heard the news about the dead coming out of their graves?

npc.name: Borin
npc.interaction_journal: I found Borin's Scrying Orb for him. He told me that a Skeleton Army had destroyed the village of Dunbridge to the east, led by a Skeleton Lord who I should kill. He suggested I go to Wentbridge Fort, also to the east, for more help.
npc.opening_initial: Hello. A great evil plagues this land. You look like someone who could help us?
npc.opening_interaction_complete: Hello, again. I'm afraid I have nothing more of help to tell you.

talk.question: I'm trying to find the source of this evil - do you have any information?
talk.journal: Borin asked me to find a Scrying Orb, located in some dungeons to the south.

npc.talk: Unfortunately I don't yet know. But you could help me by finding one of my Scrying Orbs - I put them in a dungeon to the south for safe keeping. I can then use it to identify the source of this evil.

talk.question: I have found the Scrying Orb for you

npc.talk:
Ah, thank you. Now let's see - it's been a while since I've used this old orb. Yes - ah, I see it now. There is indeed great evil, the dead walk across the land.
A necromancer is certainly behind this evil, but unfortuntely I cannot see his location. But I do see a great concentration of power in the village of Dunbridge, to the east - or what remains of it. Now all I see is smouldering buildings and rotten corpses, slain by a skeleton army.
They are led by a Skeleton Lord, who needs to be slain, but this vile creature is protected by powerful magic. Hmm, I'm afraid that's the extent of my vision. For more help, I suggest you check out Wentbridge Fort, also to the east. The soldiers there may be able to offer help.

npc.name: Priest
npc.interaction_journal: I killed the Zombies for the Priest.
npc.opening_initial: Hello - you look like someone who could help me!
npc.opening_later: Hello, again - please, are you able to help me?
npc.opening_interaction_complete: Thank you again for ridding this church of those foul zombies!

talk.question: How can I help you?
talk.journal: The priest of Axbury asked if I could kill the Zombies in the church graveyard.

npc.talk: The dead are coming out graves! At this very moment, there are two rotting corpses out in the graveyard, walking around. Please can you do something about it!

talk.question: I have killed the Zombies for you

location.name: Graveyard, Axbury
location.scenery: The text on this tomb is faded and unreadable.
The text on this grave is faded and unreadable.
The text on this grave is faded and unreadable.
The text on this grave is faded and unreadable.
The text on this grave is faded and unreadable.
The text on this grave is faded and unreadable.

scenery.name: Chest
scenery.item: When you stare into this Orb, it shows nothing but blackness.

scenery.name: Crate
scenery.item: When you stare into this Orb, you see swirling lights of many different colours.
scenery.armour: This magical plate armour is as strong as regular plate, but much lighter.

scenery.name: Crate
scenery.item: When you stare into this Orb, you see swirling lights of many different colours.

scenery.name: Signpost
scenery.confirm_text: Do you wish to travel west to the village of Axbury?

scenery.name: Signpost
scenery.confirm_text: Do you wish to travel east to the village of Stockton?

scenery.name: Signpost
scenery.confirm_text: Do you wish to travel north to Oakley Farm?

npc.name: Peasant
npc.opening_later: I'm not interested in talking to you, stranger.

npc.name: Peasant
npc.opening_initial: Hello stranger, welcome to our town.

npc.name: Peasant
npc.opening_initial: Hello, I don't think I've seen you here before.

npc.name: Priest
npc.opening_initial: I'm afraid I'm too busy to talk right now - too many people dying from unnatural disease, and now strange haunting noises from the vaults. The gods have cursed us!
npc.opening_later: I'm afraid I'm too busy to talk right now - too many people dying from unnatural disease, and now strange haunting noises from the vaults. The gods have cursed us!

location.name: Jail, Middleham
location.scenery: Peering through the small hole in the cell door, you see a small dark room. After a few moments, you can make out the shape of someone crouching on the stone floor, chained to the wall.
Peering through the small hole in the cell door, you see the face of a woman. She pleads you to let her out, though the door is locked shut.

npc.name: Jailer
npc.opening_initial: Hello, how can I help you?

talk.question: What are these prisoners here for?

scenery.name: Signpost
scenery.confirm_text: Do you wish to travel south to the town of Middleham?

npc.name: Farmer
npc.interaction_journal: I killed the Skeletons outside Oakley Farm.
npc.opening_interaction_complete: Hello, again. Thank you for destroying those skeletons!

talk.question: I have killed the skeletons outside.

scenery.name: Signpost
scenery.confirm_text: Do you wish to travel west to the town of Middleham?

scenery.name: Signpost
scenery.confirm_text: Do you wish to travel east to Wentbridge Fort?

npc.name: Magnus
npc.interaction_journal: I found Magnus's heirloom for him, who in return gave me 25 gold pieces as a reward.
npc.opening_interaction_complete: Thank you again for your help.

talk.question: What are you doing here?
talk.journal: Magnus has asked me to retrive his heirloom from his home, that has been invaded by zombies.

npc.talk: My home still has those awful creatures in there. I wonder ... I know it's silly to worry about material goods when I am lucky to be alive, but there is a treasured heirloom of mine that has been in my family for generations. I would be grateful if someone were to retrieve it for me from my home.
Thank you! Here, have 25 gold pieces as a reward.

location.name: Wentbridge Fort

scenery.name: Signpost
scenery.confirm_text: Do you wish to travel west to the village of Stockton?

location.scenery: The sign, which is spattered with blood, bears the warning: "Beware the Krulls"

scenery.name: Crate
scenery.item: This is a tattered old journal, its pages worn from age, whilst spatters of blood on the cover look more recent. Inside are large numbers of diary entries of someone's life, going back many years.

npc.name: Soldier
npc.opening_initial: Hello stranger - welcome to Wentbridge Fort.

scenery.name: Cabinet
scenery.item: This book describes the history of Wentbridge Fort, since its construction in the year 1070.

npc.name: Gregory
npc.interaction_journal: I found Gregory's Journal for him, and he gave me 50 gold pieces as a reward.
npc.opening_initial: Hello stranger - you look like a sort who might be able to help me?

talk.question: How can I help you?
talk.journal: Gregory asked me to find his journal, taken by some creatures. Their camp is located in the woods nearby Wentbridge Fort.

npc.talk:
I was travelling here a few days ago, but on the way here I was attacked by some savages. Thankfully I managed to get away from them, but they snatched my bag. Most of the items are replaceable, but they took my journal, that I have kept for many years.
I doubt the thugs can even read, it's no use to them. I don't suppose a brave warrior like yourself could find the item? There are 50 gold pieces in it for you. The people here tell me that they keep a camp in the woods nearby. And you'd be doing everyone a favour if you were to get rid of them.
Thank you! Here, have 50 gold pieces as a reward.

scenery.name: Door
scenery.exit_location: Guest Room, Ground Level, Wentbridge Fort

location.name: Guest Room, Ground Level, Wentbridge Fort

npc.name: Hectar
npc.interaction_journal: I killed the Skeletons in the dungeon beneath Wentbridge Fort. Hectar gave me a talisman, to protect me from the undead plague.
npc.opening_initial: I am Hectar, the Captain of Wentbridge Fort.
npc.opening_interaction_complete: Hello, again. Good luck in your quest.

talk.question: Can you help me destroy the Skeleton Army that has invaded this land?
talk.journal: Hectar told me that he had created a talisman to protect against a plague carried by the skeleton army. In order to get it, I have to prove my worth by killing all the skeletons in the dungeon beneath Wentbridge Fort. The key to the dungeon is located in the chest in the same room as Hectar.

npc.talk:
We have tried to engage the army in battle, but our soldiers ended up being infected with a mysterious plague, killing or severely weakening them.
We returned to the safety of this fort, and set our scholars and wizards to work. They have now perfected a talisman to protect someone from this evil plague. But it won't protect an entire army - we need a hero to venture into the dungeons that have been constructed beneath the village of Dunbridge, and, protected by our talisman, find and slay the Skeleton Lord.
However we can't give away this precious talisman to anyone. If you think you are worthy of this quest, you must prove yourself. Beneath this fort is a dungeon - we use it to lock up criminals, but now it is inhabited by skeletons. Kill them all, and I will give you the talisman. You will find a key to the dungeons in the chest in this room.

talk.question: I have slain all the skeletons, may I now have the talisman?

npc.talk: You have proven yourself a worthy champion, though the quest that lies before you I fear will be far harder. Here is the talisman, and I hope you are able to succeed in destroying the undead evil.

scenery.name: Trapdoor
scenery.confirm_text: There is a trapdoor in this room. Do you want to drop down into the room below?

npc.name: Orc Champion
npc.ring: The ring is plain, except for a symbol of a small pair of wings.

npc.name: Prisoner
npc.opening_initial: Hello... have you come to free me?

talk.question: Why are you locked up down here?

npc.talk: I was caught poaching in the Fort grounds. Got myself locked up down here for five miserable years... is it time for me to be let out?
